result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Anthony Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Causing Mental Harm to Child, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.04(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Probation conditions apply, exception is the condition time.

miscConds.notes:
Pay the balance of all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges-to be paid over period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Provide a DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge-to be paid over period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

**RESTITUTION SET AT ZERO**

-Obtain a GED or HSED;
-Successfully complete a job training program to enhance ability to obtain employment.

-Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never possess a firearm or body armor.
-Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
No contact with the victim directly or indirectly

If defendant successfully completes probation without any violations and pays all court costs, fees and surcharges in full, Court will schedule a hearing to hear arguments whether or not defendant should be allowed to petition the Court for expungement.

-Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment;
-Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.

Filed: Order for Commitment for Condition Time for Non-Compliance with Probation Conditions--Domestic Violence Court.

IT IS ORDERED:

That a commitment be issued forthwith directing the Sheriff of Milwaukee County to take the said Defendant into custody to spend 76 days straight time, with no good time credit, as condition time in the House of Correction for said Defendant's non-compliance with the aforementioned condition of probation.

Pursuant to current District Court Rules, this case is assigned and 
forwarded to Judge Colon for review. os

1/22/16 bail refund notice mailed to surety.

Defendant Michael Anthony Brown in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm for Sara Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  Sentencing proceeds. No changes made to private PSI report. Statements made by the State, defense counsel and defendant. Additional statements made by defendant's father, Jon S.


Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 6 YEARS.
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS.
Credit given for 172 days time served if revoked.

Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program - IF DEEMED APPROPRIATE BY WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS.
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program - IF DEEMED APPROPRIATE BY WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS.

COURT STAYS sentence and places defendant on PROBATION for 3 YEARS under the supervision of Wisconsin Department of Corrections.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION (AS TO COUNT 1): 
* Comply with the standard rules of probation/extended supervision.
* SERVE 90 DAYS "condition time" - STAYED.  To be used at the Probation Department's discretion.
* No contact with the victim directly or indirectly.
* Obtain a GED or HSED.
* Successfully complete a job training program to enhance ability to obtain employment,
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Cooperate and participate with a sex offender evaluation and follow any recommended treatment.
* Successfully complete domestic abuse counseling.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Court ordered defendant to comply with a 5 year sex offender reporting requirement.
* If defendant successfully completes probation without any violations and pays all court costs, fees, and surcharges in full Court will schedule a hearing to hear arguments whether or not defendant should be allowed to petition the Court for expungement. 
* Restitution is set at ZERO.
* The conditions of extended supervision are the same as the conditions of probation.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Defendant's Letter of Apology.
ALTERNATIVE PRESENTENCE INVESTIGATION REPORT, RECEIVED AND FILED (10 pages)

15RM049742  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
11-04-2015
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement filed by Atty. Thomas Harris on behalf of the defendant.

If cash bail is posted in full, Court ordered TURNOVER TO:  Justice Point Pretrial Electronic (GPS) Monitoring Program.  Conditions of release:  (1) No direct or indirect contact with the victim, victim's family, or within a 1 block radius of victim's residence.  (2) No use of cell phones or any other electronic devices with communication capabilities.  (3) Maintain absolute sobriety.  (4) Submit to random urine screens.  (5) No possession of firearms.  
**Defendant is allowed to go anywhere he needs to go EXCEPT within a 1 block radius of the victim's residence.

Defendant Michael Anthony Brown in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Michael Anthony Brown in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered Count #1 AMENDED to:  Mental Harm to Child [a Class F FELONY], contrary to Wisc. Stats. Sec. 948.04(1), 939.50(3)(f).

AS TO COUNT 1 (AMENDED):  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

Court addressed bail:  Court continued the $1,100.00 cash bail order.  Court ordered that the $1,000.00 cash bail on deposit in case# 15CF1647 is to be transferred and held on deposit in case# 15CF1404.    $100.00 cash bail is needed for defendant to be released on bail.  If cash bail is posted in full, Court ordered TURNOVER TO:  Justice Point Pretrial Electronic (GPS) Monitoring Program.  Conditions of release:  (1) No direct or indirect contact with the victim, victim's family, or within a 1 block radius of victim's residence.  (2) No use of cell phones or any other electronic devices with communication capabilities.  (3) Maintain absolute sobriety.  (4) Submit to random urine screens.  (5) No possession of firearms.  
**Defendant is allowed to go anywhere he needs to go EXCEPT within a 1 block radius of the victim's residence.

Case adjourned to 01-19-2016 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Sentencing Hearing.

This matter was originally scheduled for a status of counsel, however, the parties are unable to proceed.

Defendant Michael Anthony Brown in court with attorney Robert Lee Taylor.  Defendant Michael Anthony Brown in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

State's motion to have defense counsel removed because of inherent conflict heard and GRANTED.

Court CANCELED the 08-26-2015 at 9:00 AM Jury Trial date before Judge Donald's Court.

Defendant Michael Anthony Brown in court with attorney Robert Lee Taylor.  Defendant Michael Anthony Brown in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Parties acknowledge receipt of a copy of the doctor's report.  Parties do not challenge the report.  Based on the report, Court finds the defendant is competent to proceed.  Court orders the bail and proceedings reinstated.

On motion of the State, Court orders cases 15cf1404 and 15cf1647 joined for jury trial.   Attorney Taylor has a another jury trial set on the jury date.  Court sets this case as a back-up case.  

Per Chief Judge Directive of 15-10, parties are advised that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be assigned to Branch 02, Judge Joseph Donald, in Room 506 of the Safety Building.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 09:00 am.
